discover_huge_microfrontend.txt: Discover how a complexe corporate website can be intergrated as a microfrontend

find_info_about_design_systems.title: Storybook
find_info_about_design_systems.txt: See how design systems are catalysts to mastering complex microfrontend intergrations

design_systems.title: Examples
design_systems.txt: Storybook is a frontend workshop for building UI components and pages in isolation.

story_book.title: Documentation
story_book.txt: As a product's UI expands, Storybook becomes a living directory that organizes every UI component and its stories.

slide1.title: Separate microfrontend shells
slide1.paragraph2: Each build is comprised of local modules and has the potential to load remote modules from other containers at runtime. Remote modules can be shared, scoped and version controlled.

slide2.title: Microfrontends as SSR remotes
slide2.paragraph2: Each build acts as a container and also consumes other builds as containers.

slide3.title: Microfrontends as a two-way host
slide3.paragraph2: Containers can use modules from other containers and manage circular dependencies between containers.

slide4.suptitle: Optimised dynamic imports, chunk loading and tree shaking
slide4.title: Microfrontends as NextJS pages
slide4.paragraph2: Multiple separate builds can form a single page application. By efficiently binding routing mechanisms with react state management, we can achieve seamless navigation between different microfrontends (history back)

greetings.title: Hi there, I'm Inoe
greetings.description1: A design system architect, specializing in <LinkDRY>DRY</LinkDRY> microfrontend solutions to DRIVE your React and React-Native projects.
greetings.description2: Typically I create processes that transform <LinkLESS>LESS</LinkLESS> or <LinkSASS>SASS</LinkSASS> into <LinkCSSMODULES>CSS Modules</LinkCSSMODULES> by way of <LinkWEBPACK>Webpack</LinkWEBPACK>, <LinkPOSTCSS>PostCSS</LinkPOSTCSS> and <LinkTYPESCRIPT>Typescript</LinkTYPESCRIPT> that feed into <LinkEMOTION>Emotion</LinkEMOTION> and <LinkSTYLEDCOMPONENT>Styled-components</LinkSTYLEDCOMPONENT> libraries
greetings.description3: Designers can interact with the framework thru <LinkSTORYBOOK>Storybook</LinkSTORYBOOK> and <LinkFIGMA>Figma</LinkFIGMA> while developers will consume and RE-USE these design components in their everyday tasks. Productivity is streamlined across different teams and departments helping to establish a coherent brand throughout the company.
greetings.description4: All this with a blistering fast <LinkCICD>CI/CD pipeline</LinkCICD> that includes proper <LinkEND2END>End-to-End testing</LinkEND2END> with <LinkCYPRESS>Cypress</LinkCYPRESS> or <LinkPUPPETEER>Jest Puppeteer</LinkPUPPETEER>. Each stage is exported as a <LinkDOCKER>Docker</LinkDOCKER> image to facilitate sharing and deployment
greetings.description5: Over the many years working as a fullstack web developper and css intergrator, I have adopted a more <LinkDEVOPS>DevOps</LinkDEVOPS> role for <LinkBACKFORFRONT>Back for Front</LinkBACKFORFRONT> structures. My focus today is implementing solutions necessary to manage large monorepos on <LinkGITLAB>Gitlab</LinkGITLAB> and <LinkGITHUB>Github</LinkGITHUB> within the context of complex <LinkMF>microfrontend architectures</LinkMF>.

portfolio.title: Inoe's Portfolio
portfolio.description: A passionate Full Stack Web Developer and Mobile App Developer.
